Default: Enabled if AppLocker is enabled? 1 MB

Recommended: This log is recommended to enable if you want to disable NTLM authentication

Default: If a script is flagged as suspicious by AMSI
Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success
Recommended: Client and Server OSes: Success and Failure
Volume: Depends on NTLM usage. Could be high on DCs and low on clients and servers.

Default: Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success
Recommended: Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success and Failure

Default: Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success
Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success

Recommended: Success and Failure if sysmon is not configured
No Auditing unless you want to track the lifespan of processes

Volume: High on RPC servers (According to Microsoft)

Default: Client OS: No Auditing | Server OS: Success
Recommended: Client OS: No Auditing | ADDS Server: Success and Failure
Client OS: No Auditing | ADDS Server: Success and Failure

Volume: Adds an extra 4627 event to every logon
Adds an extra 4627 event to every logon

Default: Client OS: Success | Server OS: Success and Failure
Volume: Low on clients, medium on DCs or network servers
Low on clients. Medium on DC or network servers

Recommended: Success and Failure for AD CS role servers
No Auditing due to the high noise level. Enable if you can though
Volume: Very high for file servers and DCs, however, may be necessary if you want to track who is accessing what files as well as detect various lateral movement
High for file servers and DCs

Recommended: Enable SACLs just for sensitive files
Success and Failure if you have enough space and are not monitoring network connections with sysmon. This should cause a high amount of events though
Success and Failure for AD CS role servers
Success and Failure but do not enable Audit the access of global system objects as you will generate too many 4663: Object Access events
Volume: High if auditing access of global object access is enabled

Recommended: Set SACLs for only the registry keys that you want to monitor
Success and Failure if you want to monitor external device usage
Volume: Depends on how much removable storage is used

Recommended: Success and Failure for AD CS role servers
Volume: Success and Failure if you can but may cause too high volume of noise so should be tested beforehand

Recommended: No Auditing (Note: ACSC recommends Success and Failure, however, this results in a lot of noise of 5447 (A Windows Filtering Platform filter has been changed) events being generated.)
Success and Failure However, this may be too noisy
